member.name: T:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Switch
member.summary: Provides universal access to Switch drivers

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Switch.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a Switch object with the given Prog ID

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Switch.Choose(System.String)
member.summary: Brings up the ASCOM Chooser Dialog to choose a Switch
member.param: Switch Prog ID for default or null for None
member.returns: Prog ID for chosen Switch or null for none

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Switch.GetSwitch(System.Int16)
member.summary: Returns the state of the switch number ID
member.param: Switch numbr
member.returns: Switch state, True is on, False off

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Switch.GetSwitchName(System.Int16)
member.summary: Returns the switch state
member.param: Switch name
member.returns: Switch state, True is On, False off

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Switch.SetSwitch(System.Int16,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets a switch
member.param: Switch number
State, true is on, false off

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Switch.SetSwitchName(System.Int16,System.String)
member.summary: Turn a switch on or off
member.param: Switch name
true is on, false off

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Switch.SetupDialog
member.summary: Launches a configuration dialog box for the driver. The call will not return until the user clicks OK or cancel manually.
member.exception: Must throw an exception if Setup dialog is unavailable.

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Switch.Dispose
member.summary: Dispose the late-bound interface, if needed. Will release it via COM if it is a COM object, else if native .NET will just dereference it for GC.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Switch.Connected
member.summary: Set True to Connect to the switches; set False to terminate the Connection. The current Connected status can also be read back as this property. An exception will be raised if the Connected fails to change state for any reason.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Switch.Description
member.summary: Returns a description of the Switch controller

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Switch.DriverInfo
member.summary: Returns the driver info

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Switch.DriverVersion
member.summary: Returns the driver version

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Switch.InterfaceVersion
member.summary: Returns the Switch Interface version

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Switch.MaxSwitch
member.summary: Returns the number of switches

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Switch.Name
member.summary: returns the name of the switch interface

member.name: T:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Dome
member.summary: Provides universal access to ASCOM Dome drivers

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Dome.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor for Dome class. Creates a Dome based on the ProgID in the DomeID string.
member.param: The progID of the dome to be instantiated

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Dome.Choose(System.String)
member.summary: Shows the ASCOM Chooser to select a Dome.
member.param: Prog ID of the default dome to select. Null if no default is to be set.
member.returns: The Prog ID of the Dome chosen, or Null if no dome is chose, or the dialog is canceled.

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Dome.AbortSlew
member.summary: Immediately cancel current dome operation. Calling this method will immediately disable hardware slewing (Dome.Slaved will become False). Raises an error if a communications failure occurs, or if the command is known to have failed.

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Dome.CloseShutter
member.summary: Close shutter or otherwise shield telescope from the sky.

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Dome.CommandBlind(System.String)
member.summary: Send a string command directly to the dome without expecting response data. Raises an error if not supported or if a communications failure occurs.

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Dome.CommandBool(System.String)
member.summary: Send a string command directly to the dome, returning a True / False response. Raises an error if not supported or if a communications failure occurs.
member.param: Raw command string to be sent to the dome.
member.returns: True if the response indicated True or success, else False.

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Dome.CommandString(System.String)
member.summary: Send a string command directly to the dome, returning the response string. Raises an error if not supported or if a communications failure occurs.
member.param: Raw command string to be sent to the dome.

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Dome.FindHome
member.summary: Description and version information about this ASCOM dome driver.

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Dome.OpenShutter
member.summary: Open shutter or otherwise expose telescope to the sky. Raises an error if not supported or if a communications failure occurs.

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Dome.Park
member.summary: Rotate dome in azimuth to park position. After assuming programmed park position, sets Dome.AtPark flag. Raises an error if Dome.Slaved is True, or if not supported, or if a communications failure has occurred.

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Dome.SetPark
member.summary: Set the current azimuth, altitude position of dome to be the park position. Raises an error if not supported or if a communications failure occurs.

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Dome.SetupDialog
member.summary: Brings up a dialog box for the user to enter in custom setup parameters, such as a COM port selection.

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Dome.SlewToAltitude(System.Double)
member.summary: Slew the dome to the given altitude position. Raises an error if Dome.Slaved is True, if not supported, if a communications failure occurs, or if the dome can not reach indicated altitude.
member.param: Target dome altitude (degrees, horizon zero and increasing positive to 90 zenith)

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Dome.SlewToAzimuth(System.Double)
member.summary: Slew the dome to the given azimuth position. Raises an error if Dome.Slaved is True, if not supported, if a communications failure occurs, or if the dome can not reach indicated azimuth.
member.param: Target azimuth (degrees, North zero and increasing clockwise. i.e., 90 East, 180 South, 270 West)

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Dome.SyncToAzimuth(System.Double)
member.summary: Synchronize the current position of the dome to the given azimuth. Raises an error if not supported or if a communications failure occurs.
member.param: Target azimuth (degrees, North zero and increasing clockwise. i.e., 90 East, 180 South, 270 West)

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Dome.Dispose
member.summary: Dispose the late-bound interface, if needed. Will release it via COM if it is a COM object, else if native .NET will just dereference it for GC.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Dome.Altitude
member.summary: The dome altitude (degrees, horizon zero and increasing positive to 90 zenith). Raises an error only if no altitude control. If actual dome altitude can not be read, then reports back the last slew position.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Dome.AtHome
member.summary: True if the dome is in the Home position. Set only following a Dome.FindHome operation and reset with any azimuth slew operation. Raises an error if not supported.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Dome.AtPark
member.summary: True if the dome is in the programmed park position. Set only following a Dome.Park operation and reset with any slew operation. Raises an error if not supported.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Dome.Azimuth
member.summary: The dome azimuth (degrees, North zero and increasing clockwise, i.e., 90 East, 180 South, 270 West)

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Dome.CanFindHome
member.summary: True if driver can do a search for home position.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Dome.CanPark
member.summary: True if driver is capable of setting dome altitude.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Dome.CanSetAltitude
member.summary: True if driver is capable of setting dome altitude.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Dome.CanSetAzimuth
member.summary: True if driver is capable of setting dome azimuth.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Dome.CanSetPark
member.summary: True if driver can set the dome park position.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Dome.CanSetShutter
member.summary: True if driver is capable of automatically operating shutter.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Dome.CanSlave
member.summary: True if the dome hardware supports slaving to a telescope.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Dome.CanSyncAzimuth
member.summary: True if driver is capable of synchronizing the dome azimuth position using the Dome.SyncToAzimuth method.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Dome.Connected
member.summary: True if driver has established communication to dome control. Set to True to establish the link and set to False to terminate the link. Raises an error if connect fails.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Dome.Description
member.summary: A long description of the dome hardware / software or whatever.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Dome.DriverInfo
member.summary: Description and version information about this ASCOM dome driver.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Dome.InterfaceVersion
member.summary: The ASCOM Standard interface version supported by this driver. Returns 1 for this interface version.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Dome.Name
member.summary: Short name for the dome.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Dome.ShutterStatus
member.summary: Status of the dome shutter or roll-off roof. Raises an error only if no shutter control. If actual shutter status can not be read, then reports back the last shutter state.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Dome.Slaved
member.summary: True if the dome is slaved to the telescope in its hardware, else False. Set this property to True to enable dome-telescope hardware slaving, if supported (see Dome.CanSlave). Raises an exception on any attempt to set this property if hardware slaving is not supported). Always returns False if hardware slaving is not supported.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Dome.Slewing
member.summary: True if any part of the dome is currently moving, False if all dome components are steady. Raises an error if Dome.Slaved is True, if not supported, if a communications failure occurs, or if the dome can not reach indicated azimuth.

member.name: T:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Rotator
member.summary: Provides universal access to Rotator drivers

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Rotator.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a rotator object with the given Prog ID

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Rotator.Choose(System.String)
member.summary: Brings up the ASCOM Chooser Dialog to choose a Rotator
member.param: Focuser Prog ID for default or null for None
member.returns: Prog ID for chosen Rotator or null for none

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Rotator.Halt
member.summary: Immediately stop any Rotator motion due to a previous Move() or MoveAbsolute() method call.

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Rotator.Move(System.Single)
member.summary: Causes the rotator to move Position degrees relative to the current Position value.
member.param: Relative position to move in degrees from current Position.

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Rotator.MoveAbsolute(System.Single)
member.summary: Causes the rotator to move the absolute position of Position degrees.
member.param: absolute position in degrees.

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Rotator.SetupDialog
member.summary: Display a dialog box for the user to enter in custom setup parameters, such as a COM port selection.

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Rotator.Dispose
member.summary: Dispose the late-bound interface, if needed. Will release it via COM if it is a COM object, else if native .NET will just dereference it for GC.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Rotator.CanReverse
member.summary: Returns True if the Rotator supports the Rotator.Reverse() method.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Rotator.Connected
member.summary: Set True to start the Connected to the Rotator; set False to terminate the Connected. The current Connected status can also be read back as this property. An exception will be raised if the Connected fails to change state for any reason.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Rotator.IsMoving
member.summary: True if the Rotator is currently moving to a new position. False if the Rotator is stationary.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Rotator.Position
member.summary: Current instantaneous Rotator position, in degrees.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Rotator.Reverse
member.summary: Sets or Returns the rotatorâ€™s Reverse state.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Rotator.StepSize
member.summary: The minimum StepSize, in degrees.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Rotator.TargetPosition
member.summary: Current Rotator target position, in degrees.

member.name: T:ASCOM.DriverAccess.FilterWheel
member.summary: Provides universal access to FilterWheel drivers

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.FilterWheel.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a FilterWheel object with the given Prog ID

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.FilterWheel.Choose(System.String)
member.summary: Brings up the ASCOM Chooser Dialog to choose a FilterWheel
member.param: FilterWheel Prog ID for default or null for None
member.returns: Prog ID for chosen FilterWheel or null for none

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.FilterWheel.SetupDialog
member.summary: Launches a configuration dialog box for the driver. The call will not return until the user clicks OK or cancel manually.
member.exception: Must throw an exception if Setup dialog is unavailable.

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.FilterWheel.Dispose
member.summary: Dispose the late-bound interface, if needed. Will release it via COM if it is a COM object, else if native .NET will just dereference it for GC.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.FilterWheel.Connected
member.summary: Controls the link between the driver and the filter wheel. Set True to enable the link. Set False to disable the link. You can also read the property to check whether it is connected.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.FilterWheel.FocusOffsets
member.summary: For each valid slot number (from 0 to N-1), reports the focus offset for the given filter position. These values are focuser- and filter -dependent, and would usually be set up by the user via the SetupDialog. The number of slots N can be determined from the length of the array. If focuser offsets are not available, then it should report back 0 for all array values.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.FilterWheel.Names
member.summary: For each valid slot number (from 0 to N-1), reports the name given to the filter position. These names would usually be set up by the user via the SetupDialog. The number of slots N can be determined from the length of the array. If filter names are not available, then it should report back "Filter 1", "Filter 2", etc.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.FilterWheel.Position
member.summary:
Write number between 0 and N-1, where N is the number of filter slots (see Filter.Names). Starts filter wheel rotation immediately when written*. Reading the property gives current slot number (if wheel stationary) or -1 if wheel is moving. This is mandatory; valid slot numbers shall not be reported back while the filter wheel is rotating past filter positions.
Note that some filter wheels are built into the camera (one driver, two interfaces). Some cameras may not actually rotate the wheel until the exposure is triggered. In this case, the written value is available immediately as the read value, and -1 is never produced.

member.name: T:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Camera
member.summary: Implements a camera class to access any registered ASCOM Camera

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Camera.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an instance of the camera class.
member.param: The ProgID for the camera

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Camera.Choose(System.String)
member.summary: The Choose() method returns the DriverID of the selected driver. Choose() allows you to optionally pass the DriverID of a "current" driver (you probably save this in the registry), and the corresponding camera type is pre-selected in the Chooser///s list. In this case, the OK button starts out enabled (lit-up); the assumption is that the pre-selected driver has already been configured.
member.param: Optional DriverID of the previously selected camera that is to be the pre-selected camera in the list.
member.returns: The DriverID of the user selected camera. Null if the dialog is canceled.

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Camera.AbortExposure
member.summary: Aborts the current exposure, if any, and returns the camera to Idle state. Must throw exception if camera is not idle and abort is unsuccessful (or not possible, e.g. during download). Must throw exception if hardware or communications error occurs. Must NOT throw an exception if the camera is already idle.

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Camera.PulseGuide(ASCOM.Interface.GuideDirections,System.Int32)
member.summary:
This method returns only after the move has completed.
symbolic Constants The (symbolic) values for GuideDirections are: Constant Value Description -------- ----- ----------- guideNorth 0 North (+ declination/elevation) guideSouth 1 South (- declination/elevation) guideEast 2 East (+ right ascension/azimuth) guideWest 3 West (+ right ascension/azimuth)
Note: directions are nominal and may depend on exact mount wiring. guideNorth must be opposite guideSouth, and guideEast must be opposite guideWest.
member.exception: PulseGuide command is unsupported
PulseGuide command is unsuccessful

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Camera.SetupDialog
member.summary: Launches a configuration dialog box for the driver. The call will not return until the user clicks OK or cancel manually.
member.exception: Must throw an exception if Setup dialog is unavailable.

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Camera.StartExposure(System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Starts an exposure. Use ImageReady to check when the exposure is complete.
member.param: Duration of exposure in seconds
True for light frame, False for dark frame (ignored if no shutter)
member.exception: NumX, NumY, XBin, YBin, StartX, StartY, or Duration parameters are invalid.
CanAsymmetricBin is False and BinX != BinY
the exposure cannot be started for any reason, such as a hardware or communications error

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Camera.StopExposure
member.summary: Stops the current exposure, if any. If an exposure is in progress, the readout process is initiated. Ignored if readout is already in process.
member.exception: Must throw an exception if CanStopExposure is False
Must throw an exception if no exposure is in progress
Must throw an exception if the camera or link has an error condition
Must throw an exception if for any reason no image readout will be available.

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Camera.Dispose
member.summary: Dispose the late-bound interface, if needed. Will release it via COM if it is a COM object, else if native .NET will just dereference it for GC.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Camera.BinX
member.summary: Sets the binning factor for the X axis. Also returns the current value. Should default to 1 when the camera link is established. Note: driver does not check for compatible subframe values when this value is set; rather they are checked upon StartExposure.
member.value: BinX sets/gets the X binning value
member.exception: Must throw an exception for illegal binning values

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Camera.BinY
member.summary: Sets the binning factor for the Y axis Also returns the current value. Should default to 1 when the camera link is established. Note: driver does not check for compatible subframe values when this value is set; rather they are checked upon StartExposure.
member.exception: Must throw an exception for illegal binning values

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Camera.CCDTemperature
member.summary: Returns the current CCD temperature in degrees Celsius. Only valid if CanControlTemperature is True.
member.exception: Must throw exception if data unavailable.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Camera.CameraState
member.summary:
Returns one of the following status information:
Value State Meaning
0 CameraIdle At idle state, available to start exposure
1 CameraWaiting Exposure started but waiting (for shutter, trigger, filter wheel, etc.)
2 CameraExposing Exposure currently in progress
3 CameraReading CCD array is being read out (digitized)
4 CameraDownload Downloading data to PC
5 CameraError Camera error condition serious enough to prevent further operations (link fail, etc.).
member.exception: Must return an exception if the camera status is unavailable.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Camera.CameraXSize
member.summary: Returns the width of the CCD camera chip in unbinned pixels.
member.exception: Must throw exception if the value is not known

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Camera.CameraYSize
member.summary: Returns the height of the CCD camera chip in unbinned pixels.
member.exception: Must throw exception if the value is not known

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Camera.CanAbortExposure
member.summary: Returns True if the camera can abort exposures; False if not.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Camera.CanAsymmetricBin
member.summary: If True, the camera can have different binning on the X and Y axes, as determined by BinX and BinY. If False, the binning must be equal on the X and Y axes.
member.exception: Must throw exception if the value is not known (n.b. normally only occurs if no link established and camera must be queried)

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Camera.CanGetCoolerPower
member.summary: If True, the camera's cooler power setting can be read.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Camera.CanPulseGuide
P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Camera.CanSetCCDTemperature
member.summary: If True, the camera's cooler setpoint can be adjusted. If False, the camera either uses open-loop cooling or does not have the ability to adjust temperature from software, and setting the TemperatureSetpoint property has no effect.

members.member:
CCDCamera.CanStopExposure (read only, Boolean) Syntax CCDCamera.CanStopExposure Exceptions
Must throw exception if an error condition such as link failure is present
Remarks
Some cameras support StopExposure, which allows the exposure to be terminated before the exposure timer completes, but will still read out the image. Returns True if StopExposure is available, False if not.
not supported an error condition such as link failure is present

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Camera.Connected
member.summary: Controls the link between the driver and the camera. Set True to enable the link. Set False to disable the link (this does not switch off the cooler). You can also read the property to check whether it is connected.
member.exception: Must throw exception if unsuccessful.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Camera.CoolerOn
member.summary: Turns on and off the camera cooler, and returns the current on/off state. Warning: turning the cooler off when the cooler is operating at high delta-T (typically >20C below ambient) may result in thermal shock. Repeated thermal shock may lead to damage to the sensor or cooler stack. Please consult the documentation supplied with the camera for further information.
member.exception: not supported
an error condition such as link failure is present

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Camera.CoolerPower
member.summary: Returns the present cooler power level, in percent. Returns zero if CoolerOn is False.
member.exception: not supported
an error condition such as link failure is present

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Camera.Description
member.summary: Returns a description of the camera model, such as manufacturer and model number. Any ASCII characters may be used. The string shall not exceed 68 characters (for compatibility with FITS headers).
member.exception: Must throw exception if description unavailable

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Camera.ElectronsPerADU
member.summary: Returns the gain of the camera in photoelectrons per A/D unit. (Some cameras have multiple gain modes; these should be selected via the SetupDialog and thus are static during a session.)
member.exception: Must throw exception if data unavailable.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Camera.FullWellCapacity
member.summary: Reports the full well capacity of the camera in electrons, at the current camera settings (binning, SetupDialog settings, etc.)
member.exception: Must throw exception if data unavailable.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Camera.HasShutter
member.summary: If True, the camera has a mechanical shutter. If False, the camera does not have a shutter. If there is no shutter, the StartExposure command will ignore the Light parameter.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Camera.HeatSinkTemperature
member.summary: Returns the current heat sink temperature (called "ambient temperature" by some manufacturers) in degrees Celsius. Only valid if CanControlTemperature is True.
member.exception: Must throw exception if data unavailable.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Camera.ImageArray
member.summary:
Returns a safearray of int of size NumX * NumY containing the pixel values from the last exposure. The application must inspect the Safearray parameters to determine the dimensions. Note: if NumX or NumY is changed after a call to StartExposure it will have no effect on the size of this array. This is the preferred method for programs (not scripts) to download iamges since it requires much less memory.
For color or multispectral cameras, will produce an array of NumX * NumY * NumPlanes. If the application cannot handle multispectral images, it should use just the first plane.
member.exception: Must throw exception if data unavailable.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Camera.ImageArrayVariant
member.summary:
Returns a safearray of Variant of size NumX * NumY containing the pixel values from the last exposure. The application must inspect the Safearray parameters to determine the dimensions. Note: if NumX or NumY is changed after a call to StartExposure it will have no effect on the size of this array. This property should only be used from scripts due to the extremely high memory utilization on large image arrays (26 bytes per pixel). Pixels values should be in Short, int, or Double format.
For color or multispectral cameras, will produce an array of NumX * NumY * NumPlanes. If the application cannot handle multispectral images, it should use just the first plane.
member.exception: Must throw exception if data unavailable.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Camera.ImageReady
member.summary: If True, there is an image from the camera available. If False, no image is available and attempts to use the ImageArray method will produce an exception.
member.exception: hardware or communications link error has occurred.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Camera.IsPulseGuiding
member.summary: If True, pulse guiding is in progress. Required if the PulseGuide() method (which is non-blocking) is implemented. See the PulseGuide() method.
member.exception: hardware or communications link error has occurred.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Camera.LastError
member.summary: Reports the last error condition reported by the camera hardware or communications link. The string may contain a text message or simply an error code. The error value is cleared the next time any method is called.
member.exception: Must throw exception if no error condition.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Camera.LastExposureDuration
member.summary: Reports the actual exposure duration in seconds (i.e. shutter open time). This may differ from the exposure time requested due to shutter latency, camera timing precision, etc.
member.exception: Must throw exception if not supported or no exposure has been taken

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Camera.LastExposureStartTime
member.summary: Reports the actual exposure start in the FITS-standard CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[.sss...] format.
member.exception: Must throw exception if not supported or no exposure has been taken

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Camera.MaxADU
member.summary: Reports the maximum ADU value the camera can produce.
member.exception: Must throw exception if data unavailable.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Camera.MaxBinX
member.summary: If AsymmetricBinning = False, returns the maximum allowed binning factor. If AsymmetricBinning = True, returns the maximum allowed binning factor for the X axis.
member.exception: Must throw exception if data unavailable.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Camera.MaxBinY
member.summary: If AsymmetricBinning = False, equals MaxBinX. If AsymmetricBinning = True, returns the maximum allowed binning factor for the Y axis.
member.exception: Must throw exception if data unavailable.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Camera.NumX
member.summary: Sets the subframe width. Also returns the current value. If binning is active, value is in binned pixels. No error check is performed when the value is set. Should default to CameraXSize.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Camera.NumY
member.summary: Sets the subframe height. Also returns the current value. If binning is active, value is in binned pixels. No error check is performed when the value is set. Should default to CameraYSize.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Camera.PixelSizeX
member.summary: Returns the width of the CCD chip pixels in microns, as provided by the camera driver.
member.exception: Must throw exception if data unavailable.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Camera.PixelSizeY
member.summary: Returns the height of the CCD chip pixels in microns, as provided by the camera driver.
member.exception: Must throw exception if data unavailable.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Camera.SetCCDTemperature
member.summary: Sets the camera cooler setpoint in degrees Celsius, and returns the current setpoint. Note: camera hardware and/or driver should perform cooler ramping, to prevent thermal shock and potential damage to the CCD array or cooler stack.
member.exception: Must throw exception if command not successful.
Must throw exception if CanSetCCDTemperature is False.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Camera.StartX
member.summary: Sets the subframe start position for the X axis (0 based). Also returns the current value. If binning is active, value is in binned pixels.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Camera.StartY
member.summary: Sets the subframe start position for the Y axis (0 based). Also returns the current value. If binning is active, value is in binned pixels.

member.name: T:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope
member.summary: Implements a telescope class to access any registered ASCOM telescope

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an instance of the telescope class.
member.param: The ProgID for the telescope

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.Choose(System.String)
member.summary: The Choose() method returns the DriverID of the selected driver. Choose() allows you to optionally pass the DriverID of a "current" driver (you probably save this in the registry), and the corresponding telescope type is pre-selected in the Chooser's list. In this case, the OK button starts out enabled (lit-up); the assumption is that the pre-selected driver has already been configured.
member.param: Optional DriverID of the previously selected telescope that is to be the pre-selected telescope in the list.
member.returns: The DriverID of the user selected telescope. Null if the dialog is canceled.

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.AbortSlew
member.summary: Stops a slew in progress. Effective only after a call to SlewToTargetAsync(), SlewToCoordinatesAsync(), SlewToAltAzAsync(), or MoveAxis(). Does nothing if no slew/motion is in progress. Tracking is returned to its pre-slew state. Raises an error if AtPark is true.

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.AxisRates(ASCOM.Interface.TelescopeAxes)
member.summary: Determine the rates at which the telescope may be moved about the specified axis by the MoveAxis() method. See the description of MoveAxis() for more information. This method must return an empty collection if MoveAxis is not supported.
member.param: The axis about which rate information is desired (TelescopeAxes value)

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.CanMoveAxis(ASCOM.Interface.TelescopeAxes)
member.summary: True if this telescope is capable of programmed parking (Park() method)

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.CommandBlind(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Send a string comand directly to the telescope without expecting response data. If the optional Raw parameter is set True, the driver must not insert or append any delimiters; this must send the unmodified raw string directly to the device. If the driver cannot support Raw=True, it must raise an error if Raw is set to True. If you use this feature of the Telescope driver interface, your application will be dependent on the low-level protocol used by the particular scope you are connected to. Thus your application will not work with any arbitrary type of telescope. Raises an error if there is a problem communicating with the telescope.
member.param: The command string to be sent to the telescope.
Bypass any delimiters or framing around the command (optional, default = False)

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.CommandBool(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Send a string comand to the telescope, returning a true/false response If the optional Raw parameter is set True, the driver must not insert or append any delimiters; this must send the unmodified raw string directly to the device. If the driver cannot support Raw=True, it must raise an error if Raw is set to True. If you use this feature of the Telescope driver interface, your application will be dependent on the low-level protocol used by the particular scope you are connected to. Thus your application will not work with any arbitrary type of telescope. Raises an error if there is a problem communicating with the telescope. It is the responsibility of the driver implementing this interface to translate raw response data to True/False values for return. If you want to see the raw response string, see CommandString().
member.param: The command string to be sent to the telescope
Bypass any delimiters or framing around the command (optional, default = False)
member.returns: True if the response indicated true or success, else False.

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.CommandString(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Send a string comand to the telescope, returning a string response If the optional Raw parameter is set True, the driver must not insert or append any delimiters; this must send the unmodified raw string directly to the device. If the driver cannot support Raw=True, it must raise an error if Raw is set to True. If you use this feature of the Telescope driver interface, your application will be dependent on the low-level protocol used by the particular scope you are connected to. Thus your application will not work with any arbitrary type of telescope. Raises an error if there is a problem communicating with the telescope. It is the responsibility of the driver implementing this interface to translate raw response data to True/False values for return.
member.param: The command string to be sent to the telescope
Bypass any delimiters or framing around the command (optional, default = False)
member.returns: The response data from the telescope resulting from the sent command.

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.DestinationSideOfPier(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Predict side of pier for German equatorial mounts
member.param: The destination right ascension (hours).
The destination declination (degrees, positive North).
member.returns: The side of the pier on which the telescope would be on if a slew to the given equatorial coordinates is performed at the current instant of time.

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.FindHome
member.summary: Locates the telescope's "home" position (synchronous) Returns only after the home position has been found. At this point the AtHome property will be True. Raises an error if there is a problem. Raises an error if AtPark is true.

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.MoveAxis(ASCOM.Interface.TelescopeAxes,System.Double)
member.summary: Move the telescope in one axis at the given rate. This method supports control of the mount about its mechanical axes. The telescope will start moving at the specified rate about the specified axis and continue indefinitely. This methos can be called for each axis separately, and have them all operate concurretly at separate rates of motion. Set the rate for an axis to zero to stop the motionabout that axis. Tracking motion (if enabled, see note below) is suspended during this mode of operation. Raises an error if AtPark is true. This must be implemented for the if the CanMoveAxis property returns True for the given axis. Notes: The movement rate must be within the value(s) obtained from a Rate object in the the AxisRates collection. An out of range exception is raised the rate is out of range. The value of the Slewing property must be True if the telescope is moving about any of its axes as a result of this method being called. This can be used to simulate a handbox by initiating motion with the MouseDown event and stopping the motion with the MouseUp event. When the motion is stopped the scope will be set to the previous TrackingRate or to no movement, depending on the state of the Tracking property. It may be possible to implement satellite tracking by using the MoveAxis() method to move the scope in the required manner to track a satellite.
member.param: The physical axis about which movement is desired
The rate of motion (deg/sec) about the specified axis

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.Park
member.summary: Move the telescope to its park position, stop all motion (or restrict to a small safe range), and set AtPark to True. Raises an error if there is a problem communicating with the telescope or if parking fails. Parking should put the telescope into a state where its pointing accuracy will not be lost if it is power-cycled (without moving it). Some telescopes must be power-cycled before unparking. Others may be unparked by simply calling the Unpark() method. Calling this with AtPark = True does nothing (harmless)

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.PulseGuide(ASCOM.Interface.GuideDirections,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the scope in the given direction for the given interval or time at the rate given by the corresponding guide rate property This method returns immediately if the hardware is capable of back-to-back moves, i.e. dual-axis moves. For hardware not having the dual-axis capability, the method returns only after the move has completed. Raises an error if AtPark is true. The IsPulseGuiding property must be be True during pulse-guiding. The rate of motion for movements about the right ascension axis is specified by the GuideRateRightAscension property. The rate of motion for movements about the declination axis is specified by the GuideRateDeclination property. These two rates may be tied together into a single rate, depending on the driver's implementation and the capabilities of the telescope.
member.param: The direction in which the guide-rate motion is to be made
The duration of the guide-rate motion (milliseconds)

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.SetupDialog
member.summary: Sets the telescope's park position to be its current position Raises an error if there is a problem.

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.SlewToAltAz(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Move the telescope to the given local horizontal coordinates, return when slew is complete This Method must be implemented if CanSlewAltAz returns True. Raises an error if the slew fails. The slew may fail if the target coordinates are beyond limits imposed within the driver component. Such limits include mechanical constraints imposed by the mount or attached instruments, building or dome enclosure restrictions, etc. The TargetRightAscension and TargetDeclination properties are not changed by this method. Raises an error if AtPark is True, or if Tracking is True.
member.param: Target azimuth (degrees, North-referenced, positive East/clockwise).
Target altitude (degrees, positive up)

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.SlewToAltAzAsync(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: This Method must be implemented if CanSlewAltAzAsync returns True. This method should only be implemented if the properties Altitude, Azimuth, Right Ascension, Declination and Slewing can be read while the scope is slewing. Raises an error if starting the slew fails. Returns immediately after starting the slew. The client may monitor the progress of the slew by reading the Azimuth, Altitude, and Slewing properties during the slew. When the slew completes, Slewing becomes False. The slew may fail if the target coordinates are beyond limits imposed within the driver component. Such limits include mechanical constraints imposed by the mount or attached instruments, building or dome enclosure restrictions, etc. The TargetRightAscension and TargetDeclination properties are not changed by this method. Raises an error if AtPark is True, or if Tracking is True.

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.SlewToCoordinates(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Move the telescope to the given equatorial coordinates, return when slew is complete This Method must be implemented if CanSlew returns True. Raises an error if the slew fails. The slew may fail if the target coordinates are beyond limits imposed within the driver component. Such limits include mechanical constraints imposed by the mount or attached instruments, building or dome enclosure restrictions, etc. The target coordinates are copied to Telescope.TargetRightAscension and Telescope.TargetDeclination whether or not the slew succeeds. Raises an error if AtPark is True, or if Tracking is False.
member.param: The destination right ascension (hours). Copied to Telescope.TargetRightAscension.
The destination declination (degrees, positive North). Copied to Telescope.TargetDeclination.

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.SlewToCoordinatesAsync(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Move the telescope to the given equatorial coordinates, return immediately after starting the slew. This Method must be implemented if CanSlewAsync returns True. Raises an error if starting the slew failed. Returns immediately after starting the slew. The client may monitor the progress of the slew by reading the RightAscension, Declination, and Slewing properties during the slew. When the slew completes, Slewing becomes False. The slew may fail to start if the target coordinates are beyond limits imposed within the driver component. Such limits include mechanical constraints imposed by the mount or attached instruments, building or dome enclosure restrictions, etc. The target coordinates are copied to TargetRightAscension and TargetDeclination whether or not the slew succeeds. Raises an error if AtPark is True, or if Tracking is False.
member.param: The destination right ascension (hours). Copied to Telescope.TargetRightAscension.
The destination declination (degrees, positive North). Copied to Telescope.TargetDeclination.

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.SlewToTarget
member.summary: Move the telescope to the TargetRightAscension and TargetDeclination coordinates, return when slew complete. This Method must be implemented if CanSlew returns True. Raises an error if the slew fails. The slew may fail if the target coordinates are beyond limits imposed within the driver component. Such limits include mechanical constraints imposed by the mount or attached instruments, building or dome enclosure restrictions, etc. Raises an error if AtPark is True, or if Tracking is False.

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.SlewToTargetAsync
member.summary: Move the telescope to the TargetRightAscension and TargetDeclination coordinates, returns immediately after starting the slew. This Method must be implemented if CanSlewAsync returns True. Raises an error if starting the slew failed. Returns immediately after starting the slew. The client may monitor the progress of the slew by reading the RightAscension, Declination, and Slewing properties during the slew. When the slew completes, Slewing becomes False. The slew may fail to start if the target coordinates are beyond limits imposed within the driver component. Such limits include mechanical constraints imposed by the mount or attached instruments, building or dome enclosure restrictions, etc. Raises an error if AtPark is True, or if Tracking is False.

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.SyncToAltAz(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Matches the scope's local horizontal coordinates to the given local horizontal coordinates. This must be implemented if the CanSyncAltAz property is True. Raises an error if matching fails. Raises an error if AtPark is True, or if Tracking is True.
member.param: Target azimuth (degrees, North-referenced, positive East/clockwise)
Target altitude (degrees, positive up)

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.SyncToCoordinates(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Matches the scope's equatorial coordinates to the given equatorial coordinates.
member.param: The corrected right ascension (hours). Copied to the TargetRightAscension property.
The corrected declination (degrees, positive North). Copied to the TargetDeclination property.

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.SyncToTarget
member.summary: Matches the scope's equatorial coordinates to the given equatorial coordinates. This must be implemented if the CanSync property is True. Raises an error if matching fails. Raises an error if AtPark is True, or if Tracking is False.

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.Unpark
member.summary: Takes telescope out of the Parked state. The state of Tracking after unparking is undetermined. Valid only after Park(). Applications must check and change Tracking as needed after unparking. Raises an error if unparking fails. Calling this with AtPark = False does nothing (harmless)

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.Dispose
member.summary: Dispose the late-bound interface, if needed. Will release it via COM if it is a COM object, else if native .NET will just dereference it for GC.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.AlignmentMode
member.summary: The alignment mode of the mount.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.Altitude
member.summary: The Altitude above the local horizon of the telescope's current position (degrees, positive up)

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.ApertureArea
member.summary: The area of the telescope's aperture, taking into account any obstructions (square meters)

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.ApertureDiameter
member.summary: The telescope's effective aperture diameter (meters)

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.AtHome
member.summary: True if the telescope is stopped in the Home position. Set only following a FindHome() operation, and reset with any slew operation. This property must be False if the telescope does not support homing.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.AtPark
member.summary: True if the telescope has been put into the parked state by the Park() method. Set False by calling the Unpark() method. AtPark is True when the telescope is in the parked state. This is achieved by calling the Park method. When AtPark is true, the telescope movement is stopped (or restricted to a small safe range of movement) and all calls that would cause telescope movement (e.g. slewing, changing Tracking state) must not do so, and must raise an error. The telescope is taken out of parked state by calling the Unpark() method. If the telescope cannot be parked, then AtPark must always return False.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.Azimuth
member.summary: The azimuth at the local horizon of the telescope's current position (degrees, North-referenced, positive East/clockwise).

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.CanFindHome
member.summary: True if this telescope is capable of programmed finding its home position (FindHome() method). May raise an error if the telescope is not connected.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.CanPark
member.summary: True if this telescope is capable of programmed parking (Park() method) May raise an error if the telescope is not connected.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.CanPulseGuide
member.summary: True if this telescope is capable of software-pulsed guiding (via the PulseGuide() method) May raise an error if the telescope is not connected.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.CanSetDeclinationRate
member.summary: True if the DeclinationRate property can be changed to provide offset tracking in the declination axis. May raise an error if the telescope is not connected.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.CanSetGuideRates
member.summary: True if the guide rate properties used for PulseGuide() can ba adjusted. May raise an error if the telescope is not connected.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.CanSetPark
member.summary: True if this telescope is capable of programmed setting of its park position (SetPark() method) May raise an error if the telescope is not connected.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.CanSetPierSide
member.summary: True if the SideOfPier property can be set, meaning that the mount can be forced to flip. This will always return False for mounts (non-German-equatorial) that do not have to be flipped. May raise an error if the telescope is not connected.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.CanSetRightAscensionRate
member.summary: True if the RightAscensionRateproperty can be changed to provide offset tracking in the right ascension axis. May raise an error if the telescope is not connected.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.CanSetTracking
member.summary: True if the Tracking property can be changed, turning telescope sidereal tracking on and off. May raise an error if the telescope is not connected.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.CanSlew
member.summary: True if this telescope is capable of programmed slewing (synchronous or asynchronous) to equatorial coordinates If this is true, then only the synchronous equatorial slewing methods are guaranteed to be supported. See the CanSlewAsync property for the asynchronous slewing capability flag. May raise an error if the telescope is not connected.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.CanSlewAltAz
member.summary: True if this telescope is capable of programmed slewing (synchronous or asynchronous) to local horizontal coordinates If this is true, then only the synchronous local horizontal slewing methods are guaranteed to be supported. See the CanSlewAltAzAsync property for the asynchronous slewing capability flag. May raise an error if the telescope is not connected.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.CanSlewAltAzAsync
member.summary: True if this telescope is capable of programmed asynchronous slewing to local horizontal coordinates This indicates the the asynchronous local horizontal slewing methods are supported. If this is True, then CanSlewAltAz will also be true. May raise an error if the telescope is not connected.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.CanSlewAsync
member.summary: True if this telescope is capable of programmed asynchronous slewing to equatorial coordinates. This indicates the the asynchronous equatorial slewing methods are supported. If this is True, then CanSlew will also be true. May raise an error if the telescope is not connected.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.CanSync
member.summary: True if this telescope is capable of programmed synching to equatorial coordinates. May raise an error if the telescope is not connected.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.CanSyncAltAz
member.summary: True if this telescope is capable of programmed synching to local horizontal coordinates May raise an error if the telescope is not connected.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.CanUnpark
member.summary: True if this telescope is capable of programmed unparking (Unpark() method). If this is true, then CanPark will also be true. May raise an error if the telescope is not connected. May raise an error if the telescope is not connected.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.Connected
member.summary: True if telescope connected, False otherwise Set this property to True to connect to the telescope. Raises an error if there is a problem connecting. Some Telescope properties and methods will raise errors if the scope is not connected. In V2, setting the Connected property to True does not automatically unpark the telescope, nor does it explicitly turn on tracking. This may affect clients that use the V1 interface.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.Declination
member.summary: The declination (degrees) of the telescope's current equatorial coordinates, in the coordinate system given by the EquatorialSystem property. Reading the property will raise an error if the value is unavailable.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.DeclinationRate
member.summary: The declination tracking rate (arcseconds per second, default = 0.0) This property, together with RightAscensionRate, provides support for "offset tracking". Offset tracking is used primarily for tracking objects that move relatively slowly against the equatorial coordinate system. It also may be used by a software guiding system that controls rates instead of using the PulseGuide() method. NOTES: The property value represents an offset from zero motion. If CanSetDeclinationRate is False, this property will always return 0. To discover whether this feature is supported, test the CanSetDeclinationRate property. The supported range of this property is telescope specific, however, if this feature is supported, it can be expected that the range is sufficient to allow correction of guiding errors caused by moderate misalignment and periodic error. If this property is non-zero when an equatorial slew is initiated, the telescope should continue to update the slew destination coordinates at the given offset rate. This will allow precise slews to a fast-moving target with a slow-slewing telescope. When the slew completes, the TargetRightAscension and TargetDeclination properties should reflect the final (adjusted) destination. This is not a required feature of this specification, however it is desirable.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.Description
member.summary: The long description of the telescope. This string may contain line endings and may be hundreds to thousands of characters long. It is intended to display detailed information on the telescope itself. See the DriverInfo property for descriptive info on the driver itself. NOTE: this string should not be over 1000 characters in length, as applications may use popup boxes to display Description. Older versions of Windows have string length limitations in (e.g.) MessageBox(), which will cause an application failure if the string is too long.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.DoesRefraction
member.summary: True if the telescope or driver applies atmospheric refraction to coordinates. If this property is True, the coordinates sent to, and retrieved from, the telescope are unrefracted. NOTES: If the driver does not know whether the attached telescope does its own refraction, and if the driver does not itself calculate refraction, this property (if implemented) must raise an error when read. Writing to this property is optional. Often, a telescope (or its driver) calculates refraction using standard atmospheric parameters. If the client wishes to calculate a more accurate refraction, then this property could be set to False and these client-refracted coordinates used. If disabling the telescope or driver's refraction is not supported, the driver must raise an error when an attempt to set this property to False is made. Setting this property to True for a telescope or driver that does refraction, or to False for a telescope or driver that does not do refraction, shall not raise an error. It shall have no effect.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.DriverInfo
member.summary: Descriptive and version information about this ASCOM Telescope driver. This string may contain line endings and may be hundreds to thousands of characters long. It is intended to display detailed information on the ASCOM driver, including version and copyright data. See the Description property for descriptive info on the telescope itself. To get the driver version in a parseable string, use the DriverVersion property.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.DriverVersion
member.summary: A string containing only the major and minor version of the driver. This must be in the form "n.n". Not to be confused with the InterfaceVersion property, which is the version of this specification supported by the driver (currently 2).

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.EquatorialSystem
member.summary: Equatorial coordinate system used by this telescope. Most amateur telescopes use local topocentric coordinates. This coordinate system is simply the apparent position in the sky (possibly uncorrected for atmospheric refraction) for "here and now", thus these are the coordinates that one would use with digital setting circles and most amateur scopes. More sophisticated telescopes use one of the standard reference systems established by professional astronomers. The most common is the Julian Epoch 2000 (J2000). These instruments apply corrections for precession, nutation, abberration, etc. to adjust the coordinates from the standard system to the pointing direction for the time and location of "here and now".

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.FocalLength
member.summary: The telescope's focal length, meters This property may be used by clients to calculate telescope field of view and plate scale when combined with detector pixel size and geometry.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.GuideRateDeclination
member.summary: The current Declination movement rate offset for telescope guiding (degrees/sec) This is the rate for both hardware/relay guiding and the PulseGuide() method. NOTES: To discover whether this feature is supported, test the CanSetGuideRates property. The supported range of this property is telescope specific, however, if this feature is supported, it can be expected that the range is sufficient to allow correction of guiding errors caused by moderate misalignment and periodic error. If a telescope does not support separate guiding rates in Right Ascension and Declination, then it is permissible for GuideRateRightAscension and GuideRateDeclination to be tied together. In this case, changing one of the two properties will cause a change in the other. Mounts must start up with a known or default declination guide rate, and this property must return that known/default guide rate until changed.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.GuideRateRightAscension
member.summary: The current Right Ascension movement rate offset for telescope guiding (degrees/sec) This is the rate for both hardware/relay guiding and the PulseGuide() method. NOTES: To discover whether this feature is supported, test the CanSetGuideRates property. The supported range of this property is telescope specific, however, if this feature is supported, it can be expected that the range is sufficient to allow correction of guiding errors caused by moderate misalignment and periodic error. If a telescope does not support separate guiding rates in Right Ascension and Declination, then it is permissible for GuideRateRightAscension and GuideRateDeclination to be tied together. In this case, changing one of the two properties will cause a change in the other. Mounts must start up with a known or default right ascension guide rate, and this property must return that known/default guide rate until changed.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.InterfaceVersion
member.summary: The version of this interface. Will return 2 for this version. Clients can detect legacy V1 drivers by trying to read ths property. If the driver raises an error, it is a V1 driver. V1 did not specify this property. A driver may also return a value of 1. In other words, a raised error or a return value of 1 indicates that the driver is a V1 driver.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.IsPulseGuiding
member.summary: True if a PulseGuide() command is in progress, False otherwise Raises an error if the value of the CanPulseGuide property is false (the driver does not support the PulseGuide() method).

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.Name
member.summary: The short name of the telescope, for display purposes

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.RightAscension
member.summary: The right ascension (hours) of the telescope's current equatorial coordinates, in the coordinate system given by the EquatorialSystem property Reading the property will raise an error if the value is unavailable.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.RightAscensionRate
member.summary:
The right ascension tracking rate offset from sidereal (seconds per sidereal second, default = 0.0) This property, together with DeclinationRate, provides support for "offset tracking". Offset tracking is used primarily for tracking objects that move relatively slowly against the equatorial coordinate system. It also may be used by a software guiding system that controls rates instead of using the PulseGuide() method. NOTES: The property value represents an offset from the current selected TrackingRate. If this property is zero, tracking will be at the selected TrackingRate. If CanSetRightAscensionRate is False, this property must always return 0. To discover whether this feature is supported, test the CanSetRightAscensionRate property. The property value is in in seconds of right ascension per sidereal second. To convert a given rate in (the more common) units of sidereal seconds per UTC (clock) second, multiply the value by 0.9972695677 (the number of UTC seconds in a sidereal second) then set the property. Please note that these units were chosen for the Telescope V1 standard, and in retrospect, this was an unfortunate choice. However, to maintain backwards compatibility, the units cannot be changed. A simple multiplication is all that's needed, as noted. The supported range of this property is telescope specific, however, if this feature is supported, it can be expected that the range is sufficient to allow correction of guiding errors caused by moderate misalignment and periodic error. If this property is non-zero when an equatorial slew is initiated, the telescope should continue to update the slew destination coordinates at the given offset rate. This will allow precise slews to a fast-moving target with a slow-slewing telescope. When the slew completes, the TargetRightAscension and TargetDeclination properties should reflect the final (adjusted) destination. This is not a required feature of this specification, however it is desirable.
Use the Tracking property to enable and disable sidereal tracking (if supported).

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.SideOfPier
member.summary: Indicates which side of the pier a German equatorial mount is currently on It is allowed (though not required) that this property may be written to force the mount to flip. Doing so, however, may change the right ascension of the telescope. During flipping, Telescope.Slewing must return True. If the telescope is not a German equatorial mount (Telescope.AlignmentMode is not algGermanPolar), this method will raise an error.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.SiderealTime
member.summary: The local apparent sidereal time from the telescope's internal clock (hours, sidereal) It is required for a driver to calculate this from the system clock if the telescope has no accessible source of sidereal time. Local Apparent Sidereal Time is the sidereal time used for pointing telescopes, and thus must be calculated from the Greenwich Mean Sidereal time, longitude, nutation in longitude and true ecliptic obliquity.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.SiteElevation
member.summary: The elevation above mean sea level (meters) of the site at which the telescope is located Setting this property will raise an error if the given value is outside the range -300 through +10000 metres. Reading the property will raise an error if the value has never been set or is otherwise unavailable.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.SiteLatitude
member.summary: The geodetic(map) latitude (degrees, positive North, WGS84) of the site at which the telescope is located. Setting this property will raise an error if the given value is outside the range -90 to +90 degrees. Reading the property will raise an error if the value has never been set or is otherwise unavailable.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.SiteLongitude
member.summary: The longitude (degrees, positive East, WGS84) of the site at which the telescope is located. Setting this property will raise an error if the given value is outside the range -180 to +180 degrees. Reading the property will raise an error if the value has never been set or is otherwise unavailable. Note that West is negative!

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.SlewSettleTime
member.summary: Specifies a post-slew settling time (sec.). Adds additional time to slew operations. Slewing methods will not return, and the Slewing property will not become False, until the slew completes and the SlewSettleTime has elapsed. This feature (if supported) may be used with mounts that require extra settling time after a slew.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.Slewing
member.summary: True if telescope is currently moving in response to one of the Slew methods or the MoveAxis() method, False at all other times. Reading the property will raise an error if the value is unavailable. If the telescope is not capable of asynchronous slewing, this property will always be False. The definition of "slewing" excludes motion caused by sidereal tracking, PulseGuide(), RightAscensionRate, and DeclinationRate. It reflects only motion caused by one of the Slew commands, flipping caused by changing the SideOfPier property, or MoveAxis().

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.TargetDeclination
member.summary: The declination (degrees, positive North) for the target of an equatorial slew or sync operation Setting this property will raise an error if the given value is outside the range -90 to +90 degrees. Reading the property will raise an error if the value has never been set or is otherwise unavailable.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.TargetRightAscension
member.summary: The right ascension (hours) for the target of an equatorial slew or sync operation Setting this property will raise an error if the given value is outside the range 0 to 24 hours. Reading the property will raise an error if the value has never been set or is otherwise unavailable.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.Tracking
member.summary: The state of the telescope's sidereal tracking drive. Changing the value of this property will turn the sidereal drive on and off. However, some telescopes may not support changing the value of this property and thus may not support turning tracking on and off. See the CanSetTracking property.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.TrackingRate
member.summary: The current tracking rate of the telescope's sidereal drive Supported rates (one of the DriveRates values) are contained within the TrackingRates collection. Values assigned to TrackingRate must be one of these supported rates. If an unsupported value is assigned to this property, it will raise an error. The currently selected tracking rate be further adjusted via the RightAscensionRate and DeclinationRate properties. These rate offsets are applied to the currently selected TrackingRate. Mounts must start up with a known or default tracking rate, and this property must return that known/default tracking rate until changed. If the mount's current tracking rate cannot be determined (for example, it is a write-only property of the mount's protocol), it is permitted for the driver to force and report a default rate on connect. In this case, the preferred default is Sidereal rate.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.TrackingRates
member.summary: Returns a collection of supported DriveRate values that describe the permissible values of the TrackingRate property for this telescope type. At a minimum, this must contain an item for driveSidereal.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Telescope.UTCDate
member.summary: The UTC date/time of the telescope's internal clock The driver must calculate this from the system clock if the telescope has no accessible source of UTC time. In this case, the property must not be writeable (this would change the system clock!) and will instead raise an error. However, it is permitted to change the telescope's internal UTC clock if it is being used for this property. This allows clients to adjust the telescope's UTC clock as needed for accuracy. Reading the property will raise an error if the value has never been set or is otherwise unavailable.

member.name: T:ASCOM.DriverAccess._Rate
member.summary: Describes a range of rates supported by the MoveAxis() method (degrees/per second) These are contained within the AxisRates collection. They serve to describe one or more supported ranges of rates of motion about a mechanical axis. It is possible that the Rate.Maximum and Rate.Minimum properties will be equal. In this case, the Rate object expresses a single discrete rate. Both the Rate.Maximum and Rate.Minimum properties are always expressed in units of degrees per second.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess._Rate.Maximum
member.summary: The maximum rate (degrees per second) This must always be a positive number. It indicates the maximum rate in either direction about the axis.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess._Rate.Minimum
member.summary: The minimum rate (degrees per second) This must always be a positive number. It indicates the maximum rate in either direction about the axis.

member.name: T:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Focuser
member.summary: Provides universal access to Focuser drivers

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Focuser.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a focuser object with the given Prog ID

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Focuser.Choose(System.String)
member.summary: Brings up the ASCOM Chooser Dialog to choose a Focuser
member.param: Focuser Prog ID for default or null for None
member.returns: Prog ID for chosen focuser or null for none

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Focuser.Halt
member.summary: Immediately stop any focuser motion due to a previous Move() method call. Some focusers may not support this function, in which case an exception will be raised. Recommendation: Host software should call this method upon initialization and, if it fails, disable the Halt button in the user interface.

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Focuser.Move(System.Int32)
member.summary: Step size (microns) for the focuser. Raises an exception if the focuser does not intrinsically know what the step size is.

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Focuser.SetupDialog
member.summary: Display a dialog box for the user to enter in custom setup parameters, such as a COM port selection. If no dialog is required or supported, the method shall return immediately.

member.name: M:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Focuser.Dispose
member.summary: Dispose the late-bound interface, if needed. Will release it via COM if it is a COM object, else if native .NET will just dereference it for GC.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Focuser.Absolute
member.summary: True if the focuser is capable of absolute position; that is, being commanded to a specific step location.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Focuser.IsMoving
member.summary: True if the focuser is currently moving to a new position. False if the focuser is stationary.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Focuser.Link
member.summary: State of the connection to the focuser. et True to start the link to the focuser; set False to terminate the link. The current link status can also be read back as this property. An exception will be raised if the link fails to change state for any reason.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Focuser.MaxIncrement
member.summary: Maximum increment size allowed by the focuser; i.e. the maximum number of steps allowed in one move operation. For most focusers this is the same as the MaxStep property. This is normally used to limit the Increment display in the host software.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Focuser.MaxStep
member.summary: Maximum step position permitted. The focuser can step between 0 and MaxStep. If an attempt is made to move the focuser beyond these limits, it will automatically stop at the limit.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Focuser.Position
member.summary: Current focuser position, in steps. Valid only for absolute positioning focusers (see the Absolute property). An exception will be raised for relative positioning focusers.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Focuser.StepSize
member.summary: Step size (microns) for the focuser. Raises an exception if the focuser does not intrinsically know what the step size is.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Focuser.TempComp
member.summary: The state of temperature compensation mode (if available), else always False. If the TempCompAvailable property is True, then setting TempComp to True puts the focuser into temperature tracking mode. While in temperature tracking mode, Move commands will be rejected by the focuser. Set to False to turn off temperature tracking. An exception will be raised if TempCompAvailable is False and an attempt is made to set TempComp to true.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Focuser.TempCompAvailable
member.summary: True if focuser has temperature compensation available. Will be True only if the focuser's temperature compensation can be turned on and off via the TempComp property.

member.name: P:ASCOM.DriverAccess.Focuser.Temperature
member.summary: Current ambient temperature as measured by the focuser. Raises an exception if ambient temperature is not available. Commonly available on focusers with a built-in temperature compensation mode.
